videos.alt_text: Joost, Ski Aggu & Otto Waalkes - Friesenjung
videos.title: Joost, Ski Aggu & Otto Waalkes - Friesenjung (2023)
videos.description: The music video for "Friesenjung" by Joost, Ski Aggu, and Otto Waalkes presents a playful and humorous visual narrative that complements the lighthearted and catchy tune of the song. It features a variety of quirky scenes that highlight the cultural and comedic elements typical of Otto Waalkes' performances, blended with the musical styles of Joost and Ski Aggu, creating a unique and entertaining fusion.
videos.additional_info:
Joost, Ski Aggu & Otto Waalkes - Friesenjung (2023)
The music video for "Friesenjung" by Joost, Ski Aggu, and Otto Waalkes presents a playful and humorous visual narrative that complements the lighthearted and catchy tune of the song. It features a variety of quirky scenes that highlight the cultural and comedic elements typical of Otto Waalkes' performances, blended with the musical styles of Joost and Ski Aggu, creating a unique and entertaining fusion.
Technique - Camera Roll , Handheld , Low Angle , Ultra Wide

videos.title: Flashbulb (2013)
videos.description: A quiet film that communicates its story with a strong visual and aural aesthetic. Intricate production design and imaginative cinematography immerse the viewer in the cloistered world of a damaged individual. This is miniature magical realism with an emphasis on the painfully real.

videos.title: La Haine (1995)
videos.description: A Mathieu Kassovitz-directed thriller where we follow the lives of three young men in the French suburbs the day after a violent riot. Kassovitz uses handheld cameras and fixed cameras on tripods to create a realistic feeling for the audience. The film was originally shot in color, but Kassovitz changed it to black and white in post-production, giving La Haine its timeless look.
videos.additional_info:
La Haine (1995)
A Mathieu Kassovitz-directed thriller where we follow the lives of three young men in the French suburbs the day after a violent riot. Kassovitz uses handheld cameras and fixed cameras on tripods to create a realistic feeling for the audience. The film was originally shot in color, but Kassovitz changed it to black and white in post-production, giving La Haine its timeless look.
Technique - 1990s , First-Person , Handheld
Director - Mathieu Kassovitz

videos.title: Doechii - DENIAL IS A RIVER (2025)
videos.additional_info:
Doechii - DENIAL IS A RIVER (2025)
Doechii's "Denial Is a River" (2025) reimagines her life as a '90s sitcom, inspired by Family Matters, with a nostalgic title sequence and a star-studded cast including Zack Fox, ScHoolboy Q, and Teezo Touchdown. Blending humor and introspection, the video playfully navigates sitcom-style scenarios that reflect her personal and professional journey. Directors: Carlos Acosta & James Mackel EPs: Moosa Tiffith & Anthony “Top Dawg” Tiffith Production Company: LOTUMN Executive Producer / Producer: Autumn Maschi Executive Producer: Loris Russier Creative Director: Doechii, Moosa Tiffith, & BMR.Nem Director of Photography: Nico Aguilar Production Designer: Hensel Martinez TDE Creative Producer: Langston Siebens Production Manager: Kai Lusk Production Coordinator: Kate Kramnaia, Alex Turner 1st AD: Daniel Bennaiem 2nd AD: Delaney Forrey 1st AC: Hannah Lee 2nd AC: McKay Todd, Marianna Vashchilenko DIT: Pete Aguirre Camera Operator: Chloe Smolkin, Cordell Jomha

videos.title: 21 Savage - redrum (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Redrum" by 21 Savage, featured on his album "American Dream," is directed by Danny Seth and showcases a return to the artist's roots in London. It contrasts iconic landmarks with the grittier areas of Brixton, symbolizing the song's themes. The track itself, produced by London on da Track, samples "Serenata do Adeus" and incorporates elements from "The Shining," including the famous line "Here's Johnny!" Despite some opinions that the video could have more directly referenced "The Shining's" iconic scenes, it has been well-received for its artistic representation and Savage's performance.
videos.additional_info:
21 Savage - redrum (2024)
The music video for "Redrum" by 21 Savage, featured on his album "American Dream," is directed by Danny Seth and showcases a return to the artist's roots in London. It contrasts iconic landmarks with the grittier areas of Brixton, symbolizing the song's themes. The track itself, produced by London on da Track, samples "Serenata do Adeus" and incorporates elements from "The Shining," including the famous line "Here's Johnny!" Despite some opinions that the video could have more directly referenced "The Shining's" iconic scenes, it has been well-received for its artistic representation and Savage's performance.
Technique - Handheld , Vignette , Voyeur
Director - Danny Seth
DOP - Chewy Lodge, JAWMIDNIGHT, Thomas Marchese
Editor - Alex Liu, Alex Morrison
Colorist - Vlad Barin
Original Source - Link
Tutorial - Link

videos.title: ZOO (2020)
videos.description: "Zoo," directed by Will Niava, is a short film from 2020. It depicts an encounter between three misfits and a troubled man that takes an unexpected turn. The film is noted for its striking visual storytelling and intense narrative, highlighting the complexities of social interactions and unforeseen consequences from seemingly ordinary encounters.
videos.additional_info:

videos.title: A$AP Ferg - Floor Seats (2019)
videos.description: In the music video for "Floor Seats," A$AP Ferg gives a supposedly VIP tour of New York City on his Redline BMX, showcasing the rare and unique experience of his life—complete with gravity-defying bike tricks and a closing act of a house party that makes Harlem look like the ultimate VIP lounge. Because nothing says VIP like riding a BMX through the streets and ending the night with a raucous house bash, right?

videos.title: 21 Savage - redrum (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Redrum" by 21 Savage, featured on his album "American Dream," is directed by Danny Seth and showcases a return to the artist's roots in London. It contrasts iconic landmarks with the grittier areas of Brixton, symbolizing the song's themes. The track itself, produced by London on da Track, samples "Serenata do Adeus" and incorporates elements from "The Shining," including the famous line "Here's Johnny!" Despite some opinions that the video could have more directly referenced "The Shining's" iconic scenes, it has been well-received for its artistic representation and Savage's performance.
videos.additional_info:
21 Savage - redrum (2024)
The music video for "Redrum" by 21 Savage, featured on his album "American Dream," is directed by Danny Seth and showcases a return to the artist's roots in London. It contrasts iconic landmarks with the grittier areas of Brixton, symbolizing the song's themes. The track itself, produced by London on da Track, samples "Serenata do Adeus" and incorporates elements from "The Shining," including the famous line "Here's Johnny!" Despite some opinions that the video could have more directly referenced "The Shining's" iconic scenes, it has been well-received for its artistic representation and Savage's performance.
Technique - Handheld , Vignette , Voyeur
Director - Danny Seth
DOP - Chewy Lodge, JAWMIDNIGHT, Thomas Marchese
Editor - Alex Liu, Alex Morrison
Colorist - Vlad Barin
Original Source - Link

videos.title: THEY. - U-RITE (2017)
videos.description: The music video for "U-RITE" by THEY. was filmed entirely in Colorado, featuring various locations including mountains, a chairlift, Red Rocks, and Denver. It showcases the duo's connection to Dante's home state with dynamic editing that syncs with the beat of the song.

videos.title: Sam Akpro - Death By Entertainment (2023)
videos.description: The music video for "Death By Entertainment" by Sam Akpro, directed by Pedro Takahashi, presents the artist and his band as Wall Street-style bankers caught in an endless loop of hard work and intense leisure. The video employs split screens and dynamic camera movements to convey a melancholic yet captivating atmosphere, mirroring the song's themes of repetitive daily life and the blurring lines between day and night due to physical and mental exhaustion.
videos.additional_info:

videos.title: Majimbo - Aiza (2023)
videos.description: The music video for Aiza’s "Majimbo" showcases vibrant, energetic scenes that match the feel-good thumpy pop bassline and braggadocious flow of the song. Aiza, full of confidence, is seen walking down colorful city streets that transform into impromptu fashion runways, exuding an infectious joy and inner strength. K.O.G’s electric vocals elevate the video’s energy, capturing the pride and inspiration drawn from Elsa Majimbo’s rise to fame. The video blends Afropop, Afrobeat, and soulful R&B elements, celebrating Aiza’s journey and the empowerment of loving boldly.
videos.additional_info:
Majimbo - Aiza (2023)
The music video for Aiza’s "Majimbo" showcases vibrant, energetic scenes that match the feel-good thumpy pop bassline and braggadocious flow of the song. Aiza, full of confidence, is seen walking down colorful city streets that transform into impromptu fashion runways, exuding an infectious joy and inner strength. K.O.G’s electric vocals elevate the video’s energy, capturing the pride and inspiration drawn from Elsa Majimbo’s rise to fame. The video blends Afropop, Afrobeat, and soulful R&B elements, celebrating Aiza’s journey and the empowerment of loving boldly.
Technique - Close-Up , Handheld
Director - Will Niava
DOP - Daniel Attoh
Editor - Daniyal Shah
Colorist - Tricia Hagoriles
